pullRequest.title: Issue 1053 - execute all fhir-server-test tests by default
pullRequest.bodyText: This PR introduces a pattern where-by test execution is controlled by properties in the test.properties file.  The advantage is that new tests will be added and executed automatically instead of us needing to remember to add them to the testng.xml file.

commit.message:
Update fhir-server-test #1053

- Remove unused LOINC.java
- Refactor the testng.xml (package,classes) usage
- Fix $apply operation issue where detail was not set
- Move tests with special considerations to their own packages
	- bulkdata, db2, kafka
	- introduced controls in test.properties to disable or enable tests
- Enabled all Tests

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText:
Given that test.client.oauth.enabled = false by default, I think this comment is misleading.
Technically it is "executed" but we skip all the logic.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,43 +1,53 @@
 <!DOCTYPE suite SYSTEM "http://testng.org/testng-1.0.dtd" >
 <suite name="FHIRServerIntegrationTests">
     <test name="ExampleTest">
-        <classes>
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.R4ExampleServerTest" />
-        </classes>
+        <!-- All of these tests are automatically executed and are from fhir-examples -->
+        <packages>
+            <package name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.examples" />
+        </packages>
     </test>
- 
     <test name="ServerTests">
-        <classes>
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.Base64BinaryTest" />
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.BasicServerTest" />
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.ServerSpecTest" />
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.BundleTest" />
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.ConditionalReadTest" />

-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.DuplicateResourceIdTest"/>
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.FHIRDocumentOperationTest" />
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.FHIRValidateOperationTest" />
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.FHIRHealthcheckOperationTest" />
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.PrettyServerFormatTest" />
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.MultiDataStoreTest" />
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.SearchTest" />
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.SearchAllTest" />
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.SearchExtensionsTest" />
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.SortingTest" />
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.SearchNearTest" />
-            
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.client.test.FHIRClientTest" />
-
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.cli.test.FHIRCliTest" />
-            <!-- requires $hello operation to be deployed. 
-            Include the fhir-operation-[version]-tests jar in the fhir-server userlib dir before running the test:
-            -->
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.FHIROperationTest" />
-            
-            <!-- The following class is intentionally moved to last.  
-                During debug, the other tests interfere with the asynch nature of the test -->
-            <class name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.WebSocketNotificationsTest" />
-        </classes>
-    </test>
-</suite>
+        <packages>
+            <!-- All of these tests are automatically executed -->
+            <package name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test" />
+        </packages>
+    </test>
+    <test name="ClientTests">
+        <packages>
+            <!-- All of these tests are automatically executed -->

nodes.bodyText:
Given that test.websocket.enabled = false by default, I think this comment is misleading.
Technically it is "executed" but we skip all the logic, right?

nodes.bodyText: Given that test.bulkdata.import.enabled and test.bulkdata.export.enabled are false, I think this comment is misleading.

nodes.bodyText: what are we missing by skipping this step by default?

style-only comment

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        CodeableConcept cc =
          
          
            
                                CodeableConcept.builder().text(string("userTaskContext")).coding(Coding.builder().code(Code.of(userTaskContext)).build()).build();
          
          
            
                        CodeableConcept cc = CodeableConcept.builder()
          
          
            
                                .text(string("userTaskContext"))
          
          
            
                                .coding(Coding.builder().code(Code.of(userTaskContext)).build())
          
          
            
                                .build();

style-only comment

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        CodeableConcept cc =
          
          
            
                                CodeableConcept.builder().text(string("settingContext")).coding(Coding.builder().code(Code.of(settingContext)).build()).build();
          
          
            
                        CodeableConcept cc = CodeableConcept.builder()
          
          
            
                                .text(string("settingContext"))
          
          
            
                                .coding(Coding.builder().code(Code.of(settingContext)).build())
          
          
            
                                .build();

commit.message:
Apply suggestions from code review

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

Co-authored-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>
